title.rendered: Gulf vs Desert, International T20 Series, 2023: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Team

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Gulf: Tom Banton (wk), James Vince (c), Chris Lynn, Gerhard Erasmus, Shimron Hetmyer, Carlos Brathwaite, David Wiese, Dominic Drakes, Aayan Afzal Khan, Chris Jordan, Sanchit Sharma

Desert: Rohan Mustafa, Alex Hales, Colin Munro (c), Sam Billings (wk), Sherfane Rutherford, Benny Howell, Tom Curran, Jake Lintott, Sheldon Cottrell, Matheesha Pathirana, Shiraz Ahmed

Venue: Dubai International Cricket Stadium, Dubai

Pitch Report

(Based on the last 3 games)

1st innings average score: 175

2nd innings average score: 165

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Good for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: 67%

Batting 2nd: 33%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

In his last 6 T20s in Dubai, Alex Hales has collected 285 runs at 57, including 3 fifties.

Likewise, in his last 5 T20s at the venue, Sam Billings has accumulated 188 runs at 47 including the highest score of 54. In addition, he has inflicted 7 dismissals with the gloves.

Given his all-round heroics (76 runs and 13 wickets), David Wiese is the only player from Gulf to feature in the Ultimate Team for the last 6 games.

Chris Jordan has gone wicketless only once in his last 8 games. He is also the only bowler to take 4 three-fors for the tournament.

When these teams met a few days ago, Shimron Hetmyer (54 off 35) and Tom Curran (42 off 33 and a catch) were the captain and vice-captain of the Ultimate Team respectively.

All 5 half-centuries registered in the last 3 games at the venue have come from the middle-order batters.

In the same period, an average of 7.33 sixes per innings have been smashed.
